results.title: Haunters of the deep
results.creator_credit: Andrew Bogle, Gordon L.T. Scott and Longbow Film Company
results.brief_description: In Cornwall, England, a big American company is about to re-open an abandoned tin mine, despite being warned against it. At the turn of the century the mine caved in and many miners were trapped beneath the surface. A ghost is sighted by a local boy - it is the ghost of one of the people trapped during the cave-in and it is trying to warn of disaster.

results.title: Crac
results.creator_credit: Frederic Back, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Societe Radio-Canada
results.brief_description: Beautifully animated film which concerns itself with the lifestyle of people who lived in an age that is now past. A rocking chair, lovingly crafted from the trunk of a tall tree, is used as a linking device between generations, to show the cycle of life in a farming community in Quebec, Canada, in the nineteenth century to a museum of modern art in the twentieth century. Awards: Best animated short, Academy Awards 1981. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Petunia
results.creator_credit: Audio Visual Aids and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Petunia, the silly goose, is the self-appointed adviser to the barnyard animals. Masking her ignorance, she struts around with a book under her wing. However, when she interprets the word DANGER as “candies”, near tragedy results. Based on the book by Roger Duvoisin.

results.title: Pluto's surprise package
results.brief_description: A Disney animation film about a surprise package for Pluto. On opening the package, Pluto discovers that it contains a lovable, irrepressible tortoise.

results.title: Weekend of Shadows
results.creator_credit: Tom Jeffrey, Matt Carroll and Samson Productions
results.brief_description: A small country town in the thirties. A farmer’s wife is murdered and suspicion immediately falls on a Polish labourer who has disappeared. The local policeman forms a posse to search for the missing man. Tension mount amongst the members of the posse, all of whom have a past secret to hide or live down. Cast includes John Waters. Photography: Richard Wallace ; writer, Peter Yeldham.

results.title: The Adventures of Barry McKenzie
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Phillip Adams and Longford
results.brief_description: Barry Crocker plays Barry McKenzie, a wild colonial who heads off for London with a legacy left to him by an uncle. He makes straight for Earls Court to join up with his mates, and from there rampages through London with his Aunt Edna (Barry Humphries), “cracking tubes”, “chundering”, and “pointing Percy in the snake’s room” all the way. His adventures culminate in an interview, (minus his trousers), with Joan Blakewell and the BBC. Dennis Price, in one of the last films he made before he died, with Spike Milligan and Peter Cook add their comic talents to this ‘adventurous’ movie.

results.title: Lotte Reiniger Compilation
results.brief_description: A compilation of works by silhouette animator Lotte Reiniger. “Carmen” Carmen entices the soldier, Don Jose, to the gypsy encampment where she steals his clothes. “Aladdin and the Magic Lamp” - The Arabian Nights story of Aladdin. “Gallant Little Tailor” - A little tailor, plagued by flies kills seven of them at one stroke . “Grasshopper and the Ant” - The grasshopper plays his fiddle all summer, but when winter comes he realises his error. Jack and the Beanstalk” - Traditional fairytale. “Little Chimney Sweep - Fairytale about a little chimney sweep. “Papageno” - From Mozart’s “Magic Flute”. “Puss in Boots”. “Snow White and Rose Red” - Snow White and Rose Red befriend a bear who later claims to be a prince under a spell.

results.title: Soldier settlers
results.brief_description: Portrays the progress made since 1945 in the establishment of ex-servicemen from World War II on Victorian land. The division of large estates, the development of existing pastures, the clearing of scrub country and the construction of irrigation channels are seen on representative farms throughout the state. Fruit growing, the dried fruit industry, wheat cultivation and sheep raising, plus dry and irrigated dairying are shown, in addition to the single-unit farm system.

results.title: Jean Mitry Compilation
results.brief_description: En Bateau A visual interpretation of 3 piano compositions by Claude Debussy, “En Bateau”, “Movements” and “Clouchies a Travers Les Feuilles”. “Images Pour Debussy” Scenes of rivers, streams, waves, fields are used in this visual interpretation of four Debussy works: “En Bateau”, “Reflets Dans L’Eau” and “Arabesques”. “Pacific 231” Arthur Honnegar’s visual interpretation of a symphonic poem. “Reverie De Claude Debussy” Four piano works by Debussy: “Movements”, “Cloches a Travers Les Feuilles”, “Reverie” and “Claire de Lune”.

results.title: Yackety Yack
results.brief_description: A classic Australian underground comedy in which a group of people fight over how to make the truly collective/revolutionary/existential movie. Original intentions get sidetracked but all attempts to set things straight result in yet another, but strangely similar, script. Cast includes: John Flaus, Peggy Cole.
